content:
Students get free barbecue at the fall festival marking the end of the CCI Diversity and Inclusion week in Circle Park on Oct PERIOD  PERIOD This years theme  featured panel discussions to highlight the range of diversity issues PERIOD

The College of Communication and Informations Diversity and Inclusion Week concluded last night with a festival in Circle Park PERIOD

Caroline Mullen sophomore in journalism and electronic media could not resist the most obvious attraction at the festival PERIOD

 she said PERIOD

With burgers and hot dogs provided by CCI and a steel drummer performing in the background the crowd slowly accumulated PERIOD Although the weather is turning colder the atmosphere at Circle Park hearkened back to summer months PERIOD

 Mullen said PERIOD 

Ryan Webb junior in political science also showed up for the free food PERIOD He was impressed with the festival and what it represents for diversity at UT PERIOD

 Webb said PERIOD

The festival serves as the final event for the weeklong program that has focused on student input and education about diversity PERIOD CCI has hosted two panels per day since Monday with topics such as  and 

 Mullen said PERIOD

Part of UTs quest for a Top  public university ranking centers on an increased awareness of diversity PERIOD The administration has created a new position the Vice Chancellor for Diversity to help facilitate inclusion PERIOD The first of four candidates for the opening Rickey L PERIOD Hall visited campus Thursday morning for a public forum and question and answer session PERIOD

Hall the current assistant vice president for equity and diversity at the University of Minnesota presented his views on diversity in the UC Shiloh Room to a group of fewer than  faculty PERIOD He began his presentation with a simple explanation that microcosmically represented his ideas PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Hall continued explaining the vision he hopes to implement at UT PERIOD He focused on the importance of including all communities as well asking critical questions about community identity PERIOD

 Hall said PERIOD

After his presentation the faculty asked various questions regarding LGBT inclusion disability services and religious openness PERIOD

Ken D PERIOD Coopwood the vice president for diversity and inclusion at Missouri State University will visit today from  a.m to  a.m PERIOD After fall break Dr PERIOD John O PERIOD BelloOgunu from the College of Charleston will discuss his vision on Tuesday Oct PERIOD  from  a.m PERIOD to  a.m PERIOD Melva  Newsom from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill will be the last candidate to speak presenting on Thursday Oct PERIOD  from  to  a.m PERIOD

All of these forums are webcast live and archived for viewing PERIOD For more information visit chancellor.utk.eduannouncements20120928.shtml PERIOD
